title: UAE intercepts and destroys 3 'hostile' drones
description: Three hostile drones were intercepted over the United Arab Emirates at dawn on Wednesday, the country's defense ministry said.

title: Meta shares plummet 20% after posting rare profit decline
description: After years of Facebook's business experiencing seemingly unstoppable growth fueled by the strength of its advertising business, the company posted a rare profit decline Wednesday.

title: 12 people found frozen to death, sparking diplomatic row between Turkey and Greece
description: Twelve migrants were found dead in a small Turkish town near the border with Greece, officials said Wednesday, a week after a rare winter storm blanketed both countries in snow.

title: CNN boss quits over relationship with key lieutenant
description: CNN Worldwide president Jeff Zucker said Wednesday that he is resigning, effective immediately.

title: Satellite images show further Russian military buildup around Ukraine
description: • White House no longer calling potential invasion 'imminent'

title: Congolese man beaten to death in Brazil over unpaid wages, family say
description: Brazilian authorities have shut down a beachside kiosk in Rio de Janeiro after a 23-year-old Congolese migrant was beaten to death, Rio de Janeiro's Civil Police said Wednesday.

title: Four arrested in connection to overdose death of 'The Wire' star Michael K. Williams
description: Four men have been arrested for allegedly being part of a drug trafficking organization that sold deadly fentanyl-laced heroin to actor and producer Michael K. Williams, according to a press release from the United States Attorney's Office of the Southern District of New York.

title: Florida man took his grandson magnet fishing. Police are now investigating what they reeled in
description: A Florida man and his grandson couldn't believe their eyes when they reeled in more than just some scrap metal and bottle caps during a magnet fishing weekend trip.

title: Biden to relaunch White House 'Cancer Moonshot' initiative aimed at halving cancer deaths by 2047
description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday will reignite the White House's "Cancer Moonshot," an Obama-era initiative aimed at accelerating the nation's rate of progress in the fight against cancer.

title: Teen's Tesla hack shows how vulnerable third-party apps may make cars
description: A German teenager says he found a vulnerability in an app installed in some Teslas, which allowed him the ability to unlock doors, flash headlights and blast music. The hack highlights the relative lack of oversight in apps that some drivers can download to their cars.

title: US intel report gives more insight into possible cause of Havana Syndrome
description: An intelligence panel investigating the cause of a spate of mysterious incidents that have struck dozens of US officials across the globe has said that some of the episodes could "plausibly" have been caused by "pulsed electromagnetic energy" emitted by an external source, according to an executive summary of the panel's findings released Wednesday.

title: Two patients' leukemia in 'sustained' remission after treatment described as possible cure
description: Two people with leukemia achieved remission over a decade after being infused with CAR-T cells, immune cells that had been modified in a lab, according to a new study. The findings suggest that this approach could be a long-term therapy for leukemia -- and some researchers describe it as a possible cure.

title: The titans of Wall Street are getting much bigger paychecks
description: Big Wall Street firms enjoyed a stellar 2021 thanks to a booming stock market and a frenzy of mergers and initial public offerings. Bankers and CEOs are reaping the rewards.

title: Star witness in Ukraine impeachment saga sues Trump allies and alleges conspiracy to intimidate him
description: Retired Army Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman, who served on the National Security Council and emerged as a star witness against then-President Donald Trump during the 2019 Ukraine impeachment, is suing Donald Trump Jr., Rudy Giuliani and former Trump White House staffers, alleging they conspired against him.

title: 'Not permanent moves': Pentagon discusses European troop deployment
description: President Joe Biden has formally approved additional US military deployments to Eastern Europe, with US troops deploying soon to Poland, Germany and Romania.

title: New satellite images show buildup of Russian military around Ukraine
Earth has a newly discovered rare asteroid companion
description: Our planet has a celestial sentry leading the way around the sun, and it's only the second Earth Trojan asteroid ever discovered.

title: 'Queen of Italian cinema' Monica Vitti dies at 90
description: Monica Vitti -- a revered star of Italian cinema -- has died at the age of 90, according to Italian politician and family friend Walter Veltroni, who made the announcement on Twitter.

title: Former Playboy employees and Playmates defend Hugh Hefner amid 'Secrets of Playboy' series
description: Some former Playboy employees and Playboy Playmates are coming to the defense of Hugh Hefner after the recent debut of A&E's "Secrets of Playboy" docuseries.

title: This former Republican senator has a ridiculous reason for believing the Big Lie
description: When Dean Heller served in the Senate, he was known, primarily, as a pragmatic moderate -- a fitting political profile for someone representing a swing state like Nevada.

title: ABC News suspends Whoopi Goldberg
description: ABC News suspended "The View" host Whoopi Goldberg for two weeks on Tuesday night, one day after she drew significant criticism for falsely declaring that the Holocaust was "not about race."

title: One male hair loss treatment works better than others, study finds
description: A receding hairline. A bald spot spreading on the top of head. Painfully thin hair that is especially noticeable where the hair parts. Some 90% of men will suffer some form of hair loss during their lifetime, often leading to symptoms of low self-esteem, anxiety and depression.

title: Trump 'absolutely' tampering with witnesses as he continues to dangle pardons, Jan. 6 panel member says
Rapidly intensified Cyclone Batsirai bears down on Madagascar, weeks after deadly floods
description: Still reeling from the death and devastation Tropical Cyclone Ana inflicted just last week, Madagascar is bracing for another dangerous cyclone to impact the country.

title: USA Swimming issues new policy on elite transgender athletes
description: The governing body for competitive swimming in the US issued a new policy on Tuesday regarding transgender athletes wanting to compete in elite events.

title: Ex-NFL coach speaks out about 'humiliating' Bill Belichick text
description: Former coach of the Miami Dolphins, Brian Flores joins New Day to discuss his lawsuit against the National Football League and three teams for alleged racial bias. The NFL calls the accusation "meritless."

title: Adele to perform at the Brit Awards. Some fans would prefer Las Vegas
description: Weeks after she announced the postponement of her eagerly awaited Las Vegas residency, Adele has shared a few places where she can be seen.

title: The 2022 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame nominees include Dolly Parton and A Tribe Called Quest
description: Dolly Parton and A Tribe Called Quest don't have much in common aside from a propensity for making great music. But now, the beloved country songstress and mythic rap group from Queens might belong to the same class of Rock & Roll Hall of Fame inductees.

title: Are you a tinglehead? The weird world of ASMR
description: Does listening to a whisper send a tingle through your scalp? Do you find watching the snip of scissors around your ears at the hair salon soothing?

title: Cheslie Kryst's grandfather talks 'devastating' news of her death
description: Cheslie Kryst's grandfather is struggling to make sense of her death.

title: Donald Trump fires back at Lindsey Graham in interview
description: Former President Donald Trump called Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC) a "RINO" during an interview after Graham said it would be wrong to pardon Capitol rioters.

title: American describes the anticipation of rising interest rates as a looming 'monster'
description: In order to set off the high inflation that Americans have endured over the pandemic, banks will soon be raising interest rates that could potentially hurt those in debt. CNN's Vanessa Yurkevich reports.

title: Maame Biney: Smiling speed skater heads to Beijing stronger than ever after almost quitting
description: In February 2018 at the PyeongChang Winter Games, an 18-year-old Maame Biney made history as the first Black woman to compete for the United States short track speed skating team at an Olympics.

title: Inside Gwyneth Paltrow's serene California home
description: Gwyneth Paltrow began building her dream home in 2015, after she happened upon a derelict lot for sale in Montecito, California,on a real estate app.

title: It's groundhog day... again. See what Punxsutawney Phil predicted
description: Groundhog Punxsutawney Phil saw his shadow and predicted that we're in for six more weeks of winter.

title: EU unlocks billions for fossil fuel and nuclear power
description: The European Commission on Wednesday unveiled a proposal to designate natural gas and nuclear power "sustainable" sources of energy, after more than a year of delays and horse-trading between member states.

title: Do people trust Punxsutawney Phil's Groundhog Day forecast? Here's what the polling says
description: Groundhog Day is an American tradition that is meant to predict when spring will arrive. CNN's Harry Enten breaks down how often his predictions have been right.

title: ROC at Beijing 2022: What is it and how can Russian athletes compete at the Olympics?
description: Eagle-eyed viewers watching the 2022 Beijing Games will once again notice a now familiar acronym -- ROC, which stands for the Russian Olympic Committee.

title: 10 prettiest ski resorts in Europe for alpine fans
description: Choosing the most beautiful ski resort in the Alps is like picking the prettiest diamond.

title: Duchess of Cambridge takes over from Prince Harry as patron of English rugby
description: The Duchess of Cambridge has become the official patron of English rugby, a role previously held by her brother-in-law, Prince Harry.

title: NASA plans to retire the International Space Station by crashing it into the ocean
description: NASA intends to keep operating the International Space Station until the end of 2030, after which the ISS would be crashed into a remote part of the Pacific Ocean known as Point Nemo, according to newly published plans outlining its future.

title: A prosthetic forehead and a puppeteered appendage: Behind the making of 'Pam and Tommy'
description: When a trailer for the new Hulu series "Pam & Tommy" dropped in November, screenshots of Lily James' mesmerizing transformation into the "Baywatch" icon Pamela Anderson immediately went viral.

title: Plane battling winds at Heathrow nearly topples over
description: As storms buffet the UK, footage has emerged of a pilot pulling off a particularly challenging landing -- but not before the plane appeared to nearly topple over and scrape its tail on the runway.

title: From bunny chow to kimchi, you can eat your way around the world at Dubai's World Expo
description: Set to run until April 2022, Dubai's World Expo features pavilions from more than 190 countries, showcasing  the latest in innovation and technology. But it's also a dining destination, featuring a dazzling array of street food, fine dining, sustainable eating and concept restaurants.

title: Tonga goes into lockdown over its first local Covid cases of the entire pandemic
description: The Pacific island nation of Tonga has gone into lockdown after reporting its first community cases of Covid-19, weeks after a massive volcanic eruption and tsunami devastated parts of the archipelago.

title: WWII's 'Ghost Army' gets a medal
description: President Joe Biden on Tuesday signed a bill into law that awards the Congressional Gold Medal to a top-secret US Army unit that used deceptive tactics like inflatable tanks, fake radio transmissions and sound effects to fool enemy forces during World War II.

title: Two CNN reporters covering both sides of Beijing's walled-off city. See the difference
description: On one side, daily PCR tests, robots serving food, and isolated athletes. On the other, no access to the Olympic events for audiences or family members. CNN's Selina Wang and David Culver report from both sides of the Beijing Olympics bubble.

title: Watch British Airways plane abort shaky landing attempt
description: A British Airways flight was attempting to land at London's Heathrow Airport when high winds forced the pilots to abort its shaky landing.

title: CNN reporter gets rare access to the Ukrainian front lines. See what it looks like
description: Despite international concerns, some Ukrainians are indifferent over the prospect of an imminent Russian invasion. CNN's Clarissa Ward visits Ukraine's front lines where she sees few signs of preparations for an attack.

title: Nearly 200 human spines found threaded onto posts in Peru
description: Almost 200 examples of human spines threaded onto reed posts have been discovered in Peru, revealing a unique way of treating the dead that has never previously been documented in the region, according to a new study.
